pageTitle: RC: Soony RM-Y165 Remote instructions and codes
textBeforeTable: VCR manufacturer code numbers Press ENTER. Use the 0-9 buttons to key in the manufacturer's code number from the following chart. Press VTR/DVD (FUNCTION). Press CODE SET. Programming the remote for video equipment Whenever you remote the batteries, the code numbers may revert to the factory setting and must be reset. In some rare cases, you may not be able to operate your equipment with the supplied remote control. In this case, use the equipment's own remote control unit. If you enter a new code number, the code number you previously entered at that setting is erased. If more than one code number is listed, try entering them one by one until you come to the correct code for your equipment. If the remote control doesn't work, try repeating the setup procedures using the other codes listed for your equipment. Tips
textAfterTable: Funai 338 GE 329, 304, 309 Go Video 322 Goldstar 332 Hitachi 306, 304-305, 338 JVC 314, 336-337, 345-347 Kenwood 314, 336, 332, 337 LXI (Sears) 332, 305, 330, 335, 338 Magnavox 308-310 Mitsubishi/MGA 323-326 NEC 314, 336-337 Panasonic 308-309, 306-307 Philips 308-310 Pioneer 308 Quasar 308-309, 306 RCA/PROSCAN 304-305, 308-309, 311-313, 310, 329 Realistic 309, 330, 328, 335, 324, 338 Sansui 314 Samsung 322, 313, 321 Sanyo 330, 335 Sharp 327-328 Sylvania 308-309, 338, 310 Symphonic 338 Technics 309, 308 Toshiba 312, 311 Wards 327-328, 335, 331-332 Zenith 331 Operating a VCR Buttons on the remote control To turn on or off Press VTR (POWER). To select a channel directly Press the 0-9 buttons. To change channels Press CH +/-. To record Press [Play] and [Record] simultaneously. To play Press [Play]. To stop Press [Stop]. To fast forward Press [Fast Forward].
